ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: General knowledge about the science behind cry-electron microscopy. Learned about the math and hardware behind the microscope and how computational programs and updates have been developed to optimize the technique.
Mathematical theory behind single-particle reconstruction; technical skills to consider with Cryo-em; sample preparation; troubleshooting ideas

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very good course, would like more practical demonstrations.

Strengths: material being presented; professors engagement with students and genuine interest Weaknesses: method of teaching could be improved; assigning more videos to compliment lectures could be helpful and supporting material. Some students are more advanced than others but some material maybe be fairly new to others.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yeah, the course is helpful for cryo-EM researcher
Yes, but should have previous knowledge of Fourier transform.
I would recommend this course to students highly interested in learning Cryo-em.
